intro: Trichosanthes multiloba var. majuscula, commonly known as the giant false cucumber, is a member of the Cucurbitaceae family. It is characterized by its large, lobed leaves and long, hairy stems. The plant produces yellow, fragrant flowers that are followed by elongated, spiny fruits. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Asia and is often cultivated for its ornamental value. The plant has a climbing habit and thrives in warm, humid climates with well-drained soil.
